title: Input or Output?
text: A transformation that affects the input is within the function paranetheses, while a transformation that affects the output is outside the function paranetheses.
speech: A transformation that affects the input is within the function paranetheses, while a transformation that affects the output is outside the function paranetheses.
pacedSpeech: A transformation that affects the input is within the function paranetheses, while a transformation that affects the output is outside the function paranetheses.

title: Input or Output?
text: Does the step affect the input or output of the function?
speech: Does the step affect the input or output of the function?
pacedSpeech: Does the step affect the input or output of the function?

title: Horizontal or Vertical?
text: A $$\frac{stretch}{compression}$$ that affects the input is horizontal, while a $$\frac{stretch}{compression}$$ that affects the output is vertical.
speech: A  stretch over compression  that affects the input is horizontal, while a  stretch over compression  that affects the output is vertical.
pacedSpeech: that affects the input is horizontal, while a   stretch over compression
that affects the output is vertical.

title: Horizontal or Vertical?
speech: Is the  stretch over compression  horizontal or vertical?

title: Understanding $$\frac{Stretch}{Compression}$$
text: A vertical $$\frac{stretch}{compression}$$ means that the output is multiplied by some value b: $$f{\left(b x\right)}$$. Stretching multiplies $$b$$, while compressing multiplies $$\frac{1}{b}$$.
speech: A vertical  stretch over compression  means that the output is multiplied by some value b:  f of b x, . Stretching multiplies  b , while compressing multiplies  1 over b .
pacedSpeech: means that the output is multiplied by some value b:   f of b x,

title: Understanding $$\frac{Stretch}{Compression}$$
text: Is the vertical transformation a stretch or compression?
speech: Is the vertical transformation a stretch or compression?
pacedSpeech: Is the vertical transformation a stretch or compression?
